payload.name: clinical-operational-troubleshooting
payload.core: Blend pattern recognition from past cases, mechanistic models, targeted tests, triage logic, and risk constraints under time pressure for rapid diagnosis.
proc: triage: assess severity and time constraints immediately
pattern match: recall similar cases and common failure modes
form initial hypothesis: use mechanistic models to explain symptoms
select discriminating tests: choose high-value, low-risk tests first
act/intervene: apply safe, reversible fixes while gathering data
iterate rapidly: update hypothesis as results arrive; escalate if stuck
check: triage priority justified by impact and urgency
tests selected for discriminative power under time pressure
safety checks applied before risky actions

diff.diagnostic-41: time-critical hybrid vs structured fault-model approach
diff.satisficing-51: good-enough solutions vs full optimization; overlaps in accepting partial info
diff.case-based-15: uses case patterns as input vs pure case matching

fail.signal: skipping confirmatory tests; treating correlations as mechanisms; making things worse with untested fixes
mitigations: require at least one confirmatory test before invasive action
state what evidence would disprove current hypothesis
set explicit time-box before mandatory escalation
document reasoning trail even under pressure

ex.task: Production service unresponsive during peak traffic
ex.triage: P1 - customer-facing, revenue impact, escalate immediately
ex.pattern_match: similar to last month's connection pool exhaustion incident
ex.hypothesis: connection pool saturated or downstream dependency timeout
ex.intervention: increase pool size (safe, reversible) while continuing diagnosis
ex.result: pool metrics confirm exhaustion; recent deploy reduced pool size; rollback resolves
